Based on the search results, here's what I found about the Harry Potter merchandising market value and revenue for 2024:

## Overall Franchise Value
The Harry Potter "empire" has an estimated total worth of US$25 billion, with the Harry Potter franchise producing a staggering $25 billion in sales so far.

## Merchandise Sales Revenue
US$7.3 billion (A$11 billion) has been made from toys and merchandise, according to multiple sources. Other estimates show Harry Potter merchandise has generated $3.5 billion in sales, though this appears to be a more conservative figure.

## 2024 Market Trends
The Harry Potter franchise continues to dominate global consumer markets despite a 25% year-over-year decline in overall merchandise demand from 2023–2024. However, key drivers include nostalgia, upcoming media releases (e.g., the 2026 HBO series), and enduring popularity of licensed products.

## Product Categories and Performance

### Toys and Collectibles
Mattel and Hasbro together made over $7 billion on Potter plush toys, action figures, special editions of board games like Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit, trading cards, and even candy. Collectible items such as Funko Pop! Harry Potter Figures are popular among fans, driven by their collectible value and the franchise's enduring popularity.

### LEGO Products
In 2010, the Danish toymaker reported "phenomenal sales," with its pre-tax profits soaring to around $2.4 billion – thanks in no small part to the launch of their Potter-themed products. Interactive and building toys like the LEGO Harry Potter Hogwarts Castle appeal to consumers, reflecting the franchise's strong presence in licensed partnerships.

### Popular Items in 2024
Nostalgic items like the Squishmallows Hedwig Plush are in high demand due to their connection to beloved characters and the overall Harry Potter franchise.

## Supporting Revenue Streams
- The Wizarding World theme parks earn over $1 billion each year
- Bloomsbury reported a 30% jump in sales to £343 million ($436.6 million) and a nearly 60% hike in profits to ​​£49 million ($62.4 million) in the year to Feb. 29, 2024

The merchandise market continues to be a significant revenue driver for the franchise, encompassing everything from toys to clothing and collectibles, with strong performance expected to continue despite some market softening in 2024.
